questions: The book of Luke was written to who, state the exact way he was addressed?
In the days of Herod, the king of Judaea, there was a certain priest named Zacharias, he was of the course of __________, and his wife was __________. Fill in the gap.
Fill in the gap, “The angel told Zacharias to fear not, for thy ___________ is heard; and thy wife Elisabeth shall bear thee a son, and thou shalt call his name ___________”.
________ city rebelled against Israel after the death of _______ king?
_______ instructed Elijah to go meet the messenger of the king of Samaria?
How many captains of fifty were sent to Prophet Elijah?
For where your ___________ is, there will your ________________ be also.
According to the Gospel of Luke, what chapter is the ‘Model Prayer’ recorded in?
The parable of the man who went to ask bread of his friend at night as recorded in Luke 11:5-8 teaches the virtue of what?
Who was the mother of Ahaziah?
Who took Joash, the son of Ahaziah, from being slain?
Who was Jehoiada?
What was Athaliah’s response to the noise of the guard and of the people?
answer: She rent her clothes and cried, Treason, Treason. 2 Kings 11:14.

questions: “And he shall go before him in the _________ and _________ of Elias, to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children, and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just…” Fill in the gap.
When Zacharias questioned the angel and said “Whereby shall I know this? For I am an old man and my wife stricken in years. What was the angel’s response? Briefly summarize
answer: He said, I am Gabriel, that stand in the presence of God and am sent to speak unto thee these glad tidings, thou shalt be dumb until the day these things are performed because you did not believe my words which will be fulfilled in their season. Luke1:19-20.

questions: “When Zacharias departed to his house after the days of his ministration were accomplished, his wife Elisabeth _____________, and hid herself ________ months, saying…” Fill in the gap.
In the __________ month the angel Gabriel was sent from God unto a city of Galilee, named ______________, to a virgin espoused to Joseph. Fill in the gaps.
According to 2kings 2:2, where did the Lord send Prophet Elijah to?
Some of the sons of the prophets stood by watching Elijah and Elisha at Jordan, How many were they according 2kings 2:7?
What was the name of the river Elijah parted?
Elijah went up by a _____into heaven?
Quote Luke 12:15.
answer: And he said unto them, take heed, and beware of covetousness: for a man’s life consisteth not in the abundance of things which he possesseth. Luke 12:15.

questions: Why did God require the soul of the rich man whose ground brought forth plentifully?
answer: He layeth up treasure for himself and was not rich towards God (Luke 12:21).

questions: Quote Luke 12:31.
answer: But rather seek ye the kingdom of God and all these things shall be added unto you. Luke 12:31.

questions: Quote Luke 11:9
answer: And I say unto you, Ask and it shall be given you, seek and ye shall find; knock and it shall be opened unto you. Luke 11:9.

questions: What happened to the trespass money and the sin money?
answer: It was not brought into the house of the Lord; it was the priests’. 2 Kings 12:16.

questions: Who was the King of Syria?
What did King Jehoash send to King Hazael?
answer: All the hallowed things that Jehoshaphat, and Jehoram, and Ahaziah, the previous kings of Judah had dedicated and his own hallowed things as well as all the gold that was found in the treasures of the house of the Lord. 2 Kings 12:18.

questions: When the angel appeared unto Mary, how did he salute her?
answer: The angel said “Hail, thou that art highly favoured, the Lord is with thee: blessed art thou among women”. Luke1:28.

questions: Fill in the gap. When the angel told Mary about how she would conceive and bring forth a son, He told her and said “He shall be great, and shall be called the son of the __________ and the Lord God shall give unto him the throne of his father _________”.
Quote Luke1:37.
answer: For with God nothing shall be impossible. Luke1:37.

questions: Fill in the gap, “And it came to pass, that when Elisabeth heard the salutation of Mary, the babe _________ in her womb; and Elisabeth was filled with the ______________.
When John was to be circumcised and named and they wanted to name him Zacharias after his father and his mother said not so, he shall be called John, when they asked Zacharias, Explain what happened?
answer: Zacharias asked for a writing table and wrote that his name is John, they all marvelled and Zacharias mouth was opened and his tongue loosed and he spake and praised God. Luke1:63-64.

questions: According to 2kings 2:2, where did the Lord send Prophet Elijah to?
Some of the sons of the prophets stood by watching Elijah and Elisha at Jordan, How many were they according 2kings 2:7?
What was the name of the river Elijah parted?
Elijah went up by a _____into heaven?
Luke 11:13 states expressly that God will give _________________ to those who ask Him
According to Luke 11:15, Jesus was accused of casting out devils through ______________.
What sign did Jesus say will be given to the evil generation that seeketh after a sign?
answer: The sign of Jonas the Prophet. (Luke 11:29).

questions: The light of the body is the eye: therefore when thine eye is single, thy whole body also is full of ____________ but when thine eye is evil, thy body is full of __________________
When Jesus rebuked the Pharisees, who did he say had taken away the key of knowledge?
What was Elisha’s response to King Jeroboam smiting the arrows on the ground 3 times?
answer: He told the King that he should have smitten it five (5) or six times (6) and he would have smitten Syria till they had consumed it but now he would only smite Syria thrice. 2 Kings 13:19.

questions: What happened to the dead man who was cast into Elisha’s sepulchre?
answer: Once his body touched Elisha’s bones, he revived and stood up on his feet. 2 Kings 13:21.

questions: __________ became the next king after Hazael King of Syria died?
Fill in the gap. “Her _______, which are many, are forgiven, for she _______ much: but to whom little is forgiven, the same loveth little.
Who was the woman out of whom went out seven devils?
What is the name of Chuza Herod’s steward?
In the parable of the sower, the seeds fell on four different kind of places, Mention them.
answer: The way side, the rock, among thorns and on good ground. Luke8:8.

questions: The Lord gave deliverance to Syria because of who, according to 2kings 5:1?
A certain great man was suffering from leprosy according to 2kings 5:1.
Two Rivers in Damascus were said to be better than all the rivers in Israel according to 2kings 5:12, Name them
Who made this statement and why? “Behold, now I know that there is no God in all the earth, but in Israel: now therefore, I pray thee, take a blessing of thy servant”.
answer: Naaman, because he was healed of leprosy. 2 Kings 5:15.

questions: Who did Jesus describe as a fox in Luke13:32?
On which day of the week did Jesus heal the man which had the dropsy?
Quote Luke 14:11.
answer: For whosoever exalted himself shall be abased; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.

questions: Salt is good: but if the salt have lost his ________________, wherewith shall it be ___________. Fill in the gap.
How much did Menahem give King Pul of Assyria?
How much did Menahem exact from the wealthy men of Israel to give the King of Assyria?
Which King reigned over Israel for 2 years?
answer: King Pekahiah the son of Menahem. 2 Kings 15:23

questions: Who killed King Pekah the son of Remaliah?
She brought forth her firstborn son, and wrapped him in ____________ clothes, and laid him in a _________, because there was no room for them in the inn. Fill in the gap.

The angel of the Lord appeared unto shepherds abiding in the field and said “Fear not, I bring you good tidings of great joy, which shall be to all people. For unto you is born this day in the city of David a ___________, which is ____________ the Lord. Fill in the gap.
After the days of Mary’s purification, when they brought Jesus to the temple to offer a sacrifice as written in the law of the Lord. What was to be sacrificed?
answer: A pair of turtledoves or two young pigeons. Luke2:24.

questions: What was the name of the just and devout man in Jerusalem, who was waiting for the consolation of Israel and was revealed to him that he should not see death before he had seen the Lord’s Christ.
Why did the oil stop running according to 2kings 4:6?
How did the widow in 2kings 4:7 pay her debt?
Complete this verse, 2 Kings 4:12 “And he said to ______ his servant, Call this ________. And when he had called her, she stood before him”.
Fill in the gap: _______ loaves, of barley bread fed _______ men according to 2kings 4:43.
The Woman that was bent over as recorded in Luke 13:11 had been that way for how many years?
Which ruler mingled the blood of the Galileans with their sacrifices?
According to Luke 13, Jesus likened the kingdom of heaven to 2 things. Name them.
answer: A grain of mustard seed and Leaven (hid in 3 measures of meal). Luke13:18-21.

questions: Who did Jesus describe as a fox in Luke13:32?
On which day of the week did Jesus heal the man which had the dropsy?
King Ahaz commanded Urijah that the brasen altar will be for his personal use only, True or False?
What made Shalmaneser, King of Assyria put Hoshea in prison?
answer: The King found conspiracy in Hoshea, he sent messengers to So king of Egypt and had stopped bringing him the yearly presents. 2 Kings 17:4.

questions: When the Lord was angry with Israel, he removed all the tribes from his sight except which tribe?
What verse of 2 Kings 17 was this statement made: “But the Lord your God ye shall fear; and he shall deliver you out of the hand of all your enemies”.
Fill in the gap. “And the child grew and waxed strong in __________, and was in the deserts till the day of his _____________ unto Israel.
Who sent out a decree that all the world should be taxed?
Joseph moved to be taxed with his wife who was great with child, from the city of Nazareth in Galilee into __________, unto the city of David, which is called _____________. Fill in the gap.
_______ wounded Joram?
King Joram was healed where?
Joram sent _______ messengers to Jehu to ask if he was coming for peace?
Immediately Joram met Jehu, he asked him a question, what was the question?
Complete this verse, “And Joram turned his hands, and fled, and said to Ahaziah, __________, O Ahaziah”.
_________ was the captain of Jehu?
Fill in the gap. “If ye had faith as a grain of ______________ seed, ye might say unto this _______________ tree.
What is the name of the village where Jesus met the 10 lepers?
answer: Name not mentioned/It was a certain village. (Luke 17:12).

questions: What was the identity of the one leper that returned to give thanks?
And he spake a parable unto them to this end, that men ought always to ____________ and not to ______________.
What was Sennacherib, King of Assyria doing when he was killed?
answer: He was worshipping in the house of Nisroch his god. 2 Kings 19:37.

questions: What were the names of the people who killed Sennacherib, King of Assyria?
What was used to kill Sennacherib, King of Assyria?
Isaiah was the son of who?
Complete the statement, “Blessed be ye poor: _____________________”.
answer: For yours is the kingdom of God. Luke6:20.

questions: Fill in the gap. “Love your _________, do good to them which ________ you.
Fill in the gap. “And why beholdest thou the ______ that is in thy brother’s eye but perceivest not the _________ that is in thy own eye?”
For every tree is known by his own fruit. For of thorns men do not gather ________, nor of a bramble bush gather they __________.
Jehoram reigned for how many years?
________ made Israel to commit sin according to 2kings 3:3?
________ was a sheepmaster?
According to 2kings 3:4, who was the King of Moab?
How was Elisha the prophet described according to 2kings 3:11?
answer: The one who poured water on the hands of Elijah.

questions: Jesus said that it was better for him that a ____________ were hanged about his neck and he cast into the sea, than that he should __________ one of these little ones.
Between the Pharisee and the Publican who both went up to pray, who went home justified?
But Jesus called them unto him and said, _______________ little children to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the _____________ of God.
What did Jesus tell the rich young ruler that made him sorrowful?
answer: “Sell all thou hast and distribute unto the poor, and thou shall have treasure in heaven; and come follow me. (Luke 18:22).

questions: What sign did King Hezekiah ask for as proof that the Lord will heal him on the third day?
answer: That the shadow return backward ten degrees. 2 Kings 20:10.

questions: Who sent letters and presents to King Hezekiah when he heard that he had been sick?
answer: Berodachbaladan, the son of Baladan, king of Babylon. 2 Kings 20:12.

questions: Mention three (3) things that King Hezekiah showed the people from Babylon?
answer: All the house of his precious things, the silver, and the gold, and the spices, and the precious ointment, and all the house of his armour, and all that was found in his treasures: there was nothing in his house, nor in all his dominion, that Hezekiah shewed them not. 2 Kings 20:13.

questions: What was the name of King Hezekiah’s son?
When Jesus parents found him and his mother asked him why he dealt with them that way, that they have sought him sorrowing, what was Jesus response?
answer: How is it that ye sought me? Wist ye not that I must be about my Father’s business? Luke2:49.

questions: Fill in the gap, And Jesus increased in wisdom and __________, and in ____________ with God and man.
Who was the governor of Judaea in the 15th year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar?
What were the names of the High priests?
The servant of Elisha requested______ from the man who was cleanse of leprosy and was given______.
answer: A talent of Silver and two changes of garments, Two talents of silver and two changes of garments. 2kings 5:22-23.

questions: Quote 2kings 5:27.
answer: 2 Kings 5:27. The leprosy therefore of Naaman shall cleave unto thee, and unto thy seed forever. And he went out from his presence a leper as white as snow.

questions: A miracle happened in 2kings 6:5-6. What was it?
Salt is good: but if the salt have lost his ________________, wherewith shall it be ___________. Fill in the gap.
The parable of the lost sheep, lost coin and the prodigal son all speak to what/tells us that what?
answer: There is joy in heaven over a soul that comes to repentance. Luke15.

questions: In the parable of the dishonest manager, what was the value of the first debt?
The dishonest manager reduced the debt of 100 measures of wheat being owed his Master to what?
Hezekiah was the son of King Ahaz, True or False.
How much did the King of Assyria at Lachish ask King Hezekiah to pay?
answer: Three hundred talents of silver and thirty talents of gold. 2 Kings 18:14.

questions: What language did Eliakim, Shebna and Joah ask Rabshakeh to speak to them in?
answer: To speak in Syrian language and not in the Jews’ language. 2 Kings 18:26.

questions: What was the people’s response to Rabshakeh’s message?
answer: The people held their peace and did not answer him. 2 Kings 18:36.

questions: When the multitude came forth to be baptized of John the Baptist, He said some things to them, fill in the missing words. “O generation of _________, who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come? Bring forth therefore fruits worthy of ____________, and begin …”
Fill in the gap, I indeed baptize you with water, but one ___________ than I cometh, the ___________ of whose shoes I am not worthy to unloose, he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire.
When all the people were baptized, who came to be baptized and while praying the heaven was opened? In what bodily shape did the Holy Ghost descend upon him?
How old was Jesus after the water baptism?
In 2kings 4:1, the cry of that widow revealed that her husband didn't experience a dimension of God.
Give a word to describe what happened in 2kings 6:1-3, when the sons of the prophet told Elisha the place was too straight for them
Quote 2kings 6:16.
answer: 2 Kings 6:16 “And he answered, Fear not: for they that be with us are more than they that be with them”.

questions: Elisha commanded a certain illness upon the men that came to fight against him in 2kings 6:18, what was it?
A certain woman cried out to the king of Samaria according to 2kings 6:26-29, what was her complaint?
answer: Because of the famine, herself and another woman agreed to eat her son and later eat the other woman's son, they succeeded in eating her own son but the other woman hid her son when it was time for her own son to be eaten. 2kings 6:26-29.

questions: A prophecy was given by Elisha in 2kings 7:1, state it.
answer: “Tomorrow about this time shall a measure of fine flour be sold for a shekel, and two measures of barley for a shekel, in the gate of Samaria”. 2kings 7:1.

questions: Jesus was close to what city when he healed the blind man that cried out “Jesus, thou son of David have mercy on me”
Where was Zacchaeus resident?
Zacchaeus climbed what tree to see Jesus?
Quote Luke 19:10
answer: For the Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost.

questions: What did the people do to the house of Baal in 2 Kings 11?
answer: They broke it down, broke the altars and images into pieces and Slew Mattan, the priest of Baal. 2 Kings 11:18

questions: How old was Jehoash when he began to reign?
How many years did Jehoash reign for?
Zibiah of Beersheba was the mother of who?
Where was Joash killed?
answer: In the house of Millo, on the road to Silla. 2 Kings 12:20.

questions: When Jesus was in the house of a Pharisee, a woman who was a sinner came weeping and washing his feet with tears brought what with her?
answer: An alabaster box of ointment. Luke7:37.

questions: Whose house was Jesus in when the woman who was a sinner came to wash his feet?
What did the seed in the parable of the sower represent?
Fill in the gap. “No man when he hath lighted a __________, covereth it with a vessel, or putteth it under a bed, but setteth it on a _________, that they which enter in may see the light”.
The service of a _____ was needed by Elisha in 2kings 3:15.
Fill in the gaps. And this is but a_________ thing in the ________of the LORD: he will deliver the Moabites also into your hand.
What made the Moabites think that their enemies were dead according to 2kings 3:22-23?
answer: The water on the other side appeared to them as blood. 2kings 3:22-23.

questions: Who offered his eldest son for a burnt offering according to 2kings 3:26-27?
What did Jesus call the leaven of the Pharisees?
Are not five sparrows sold for _________________ and not one of them is forgotten before God.

Fill in the Blanks according to Luke 11:11.  “If a son shall ask bread of any of you that is a father, will he give him a ___________? Or if he ask a fish, will he for a fish give him a _____________?”
How many people did the tower in Siloam fall on?
Who was Zachariah’s father?
Jecholiah of Jerusalem was the mother of who?
What did the Lord smite/strike King Azariah with?
answer: He was smitten/struck with Leprosy. 2 Kings 15:5.

questions: Who conspired against Zachariah and smote/killed him?
How many years did King Jotham reign for?
When Jesus heard these things, he marveled at him, and turned him about, and said unto the people that followed him, I say unto you, I have not found so great __________, no, not in __________.
What did Jesus do in the city of Nain?
answer: Jesus raised to life the only son of a widow who died. Luke7:12.

questions: Who made this statement and sent his servants to deliver it “Art thou he that should come? Or look we for another?” and whom was he referring to when he made the statement?
Fill in the gap, “And __________ is he, whosoever shall not be _________ in me.
A murder was committed in 2kings 8:15, who committed the murder and how was it carried out?
answer: Hazael, He suffocated the king with a thick wet cloth. 2kings 8:15.

questions: Jehoram was how old when he became king over Judah.
The Lord spared Judah because of who according to 2kings 8:19?
The name of a certain woman “Ahaziah’s mother” was mentioned in 2kings 8:26, what’s her name?
When Lazarus the beggar died, where was he carried to and by whom?
What was the first request of the rich man when he was under torment in hell?
answer: That Father Abraham should allow Lazarus to dip the tip of his fingers in water to cool his tongue. (Luke16:24).

questions: How many brethren did the rich man have according to Luke 16?
How many times did Joash beat Benhadad and recover the cities of Israel?
How old was King Amaziah when he began his reign?
Where did the King Jehoash and King Amaziah battle?
What was the size of the wall of Jerusalem from the gate of Ephraim to the corner gate?
Where did King Amaziah flee to when there was a conspiracy against him in Jerusalem?
When Jesus got to Capernaum, a city of Galilee, he went to the synagogue and there was a man there, what ailment did this man have?
answer: He had a spirit of an unclean devil. Luke4:33.

questions: When Jesus entered Simon’s house, who had a great fever?
When Jesus stood at the lake of Gennesaret, he saw two ships with the fishermen gone out of them, whose ship did Jesus enter?
Fill in the gap, Launch out into the _________, and let down your nets for a _________.
Ahab had _______ sons in Samaria.
Jehu was blameless and stood perfect before God, He executed all that is in the heart of the Lord and did not fall into sin. True or false?
Jehu ruled for _______ years.
According to 2kings 10:29, ________ made Israel to sin?
The house of Baal was made a ______ house until this day according to 2kings 10:27.
_______ gave the order to kill all the worshippers of Baal.
Quote Luke 14:11.
answer: For whosoever exalted himself shall be abased; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.

questions: Fill in the gap. “For the __________ of this world are in their generation _____________ than the children of light.
Fill in the gap. “No servant can serve two ____________: for either he will _____________ the one, and love the other…”.
Where was Sennacherib, King of Assyria killed?
What was Isaiah’s first message to King Hezekiah when he was sick unto death?
answer: To set his house in order, for he shall die and not live. 2 Kings 20:1.

questions: What was King Hezekiah’s response to Isaiah’s message that he will die?
answer: He wept sore and prayed to the Lord. 2 Kings 20:3.

questions: How many years did God tell Hezekiah that he will add to his days?
20:7, “And Isaiah said, Take a lump of _______ and they took and laid it on the boil, and he recovered.

Fill in the gap, “And Simeon blessed them and said unto Mary his mother, Behold, this child is set for the _________ and _________ again of many in Israel: and for a sign which shall be spoken against;…”
And there was one _________, a prophetess, the daughter of ___________, of the tribe of Aser. Fill in the gap.
And the child grew and waxed strong in spirit, filled with ________ and the ________ of God was upon him. Fill in the gap.
Jesus parents went to Jerusalem every year at what feast?
answer: At the feast of the Passover. Luke 2:41.

questions: How old was Jesus when they went to Jerusalem after the custom of the feast?
_______ lepers were at the entering of the gate according to 2kings 7:3.
The hosts of Syrians heard three kinds of noise, name them
answer: The noise of Chariots, The noise of horses and the noise of a great host. 2kings 7:6.

questions: A certain character was displayed in 2kings 7:2, what was it and by whom?
answer: Unbelieve or doubt, by a Lord on whose hand the king leaned. 2kings 7:2.

questions: According to 2kings 8:1, _______ called for a famine?
In the parable of the vineyard owner as recorded in Luke 20:9-16, how many servants did the Master send to the husbandmen?
Where was Athaliah slain?
What were the names of the servants who made a conspiracy against Joash and killed him?
Who was it that reigned after King Joash?
Fill in the gap. “And it came to pass, that after three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the __________, both _________ them and asking them questions.
Fill in the gap. John came into all the country about Jordan, preaching the baptism of _____________ for the ____________ of sins.
Jesus was the son of Joseph and Joseph was the son of _________.
Fill in the gaps, “And Jesus being full of the ______________ returned from Jordan, and was led by the Spirit into the _____________.
According to 2kings 2:20, Elisha requested for a new_______?
How many she-bears devoured the children that mocked Elisha?
The famine mentioned in 2kings 8:1 was to last for ______ years.
Fill in the gap. “It is written, my house is the house of __________ but ye have made it a den of ____________”.
How many years did King Jehoahaz reign over Israel for?
In 2 Kings 13, what was left of Jehoahaz army?
answer: Fifty horsemen, Ten Chariots and ten thousand footmen. 2 Kings 13:7

questions: How many years did Jerobam, son of Joash, reign for?
Where did King Ahaz go to, to meet Tiglathpileser, King of Assyria?
Mention any three (3) offerings King Ahaz offered on the altar that he instructed Urijah to make.
answer: he burnt his burnt offering and his meat offering, and poured his drink offering, and sprinkled the blood of his peace offerings, upon the altar. 2 Kings 16:13.

questions: What was King Hezekiah’s response to the words of Rabshakeh?
answer: He rent his clothes, covered himself with sackcloth and went into the house of the Lord. 2 Kings 19:1.

questions: When the disciples saw someone casting out devils in the name of Jesus and forbade him because he wasn’t following them, what was Jesus response?
answer: Forbid him not: for he that is not against us is for us. Luke9:50.

questions: Fill in the gap. “Ye know not what manner of ________ ye are of. For the son of man is not come to ________ men’s lives, but to save them”.
Fill in the gap. “No man, having put his hand to the_________, and ____________, is fit for the kingdom of God.

Fill in the gap. “Woe unto thee, __________! Woe unto thee, _________! For if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon, which have been done in you, they had a great while ago repented, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.
Fill in the gap. “Behold, I give unto you _________ to tread on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy: and _________ shall by any means hurt you”.
According to 2kings 8:7, _______ was sick?
King Ahaziah reigned for ______ years in Jerusalem?
Ahaziah died where _______?
In the parable of the 10 pounds as recorded in Luke 19:12-27, how many servants gave account?
What did Elisha first ask Jerobam to do when Jerobam visited him?
answer: Take bow and arrows, put your hand on the bow, open the window eastward and shoot. 2 Kings 13:15-17.

questions: When Jesus took Peter, James and John to a mountain to pray, two men appeared in glory talked with Jesus there, what are their names?
When a voice came out of the cloud on the mount of transfiguration, what did the voice say when it overshadowed them?
answer: This is my beloved son, hear him. Luke9:35.

questions: When Jesus was trying to explain who a neighbor is and told a story, who amongst those who passed by the wounded and robbed man was truly his neighbour?
Fill in the gap. “Martha, Martha, thou art careful and ___________ about many things: But one thing is __________: and Mary hath chosen that good part, which shall not be taken away from her.
What did Jezebel do when she heard Jehu was come to Jezreel?
answer: She painted her face, and tired her head, and looked out at a window. 2kings 9:30.

questions: Who ordered that Jezebel be thrown down?
Jezebel body was eaten by dogs but some parts were left, name them?
answer: Her skull, her feet and the palms of her hands. 2kings 9: 35.

questions: What did King Hezekiah do with the letter he received from the messengers?
answer: He read it and took it into the house of the Lord and spread it before the Lord. 2 Kings 19:14.

questions: When Prophet Isaiah was telling King Hezekiah the signs that shall be unto him: In what year did Isaiah say King Hezekiah will sow, reap, plant vineyards, and eat the fruits?
How many people did the angel of the Lord kill in the camp of the Assyrians?
answer: A hundred fourscore and five thousand (185,000). 2 Kings 19:35.

questions: When Jesus sent out the devils from the man at Gadarene, where did those devils enter and what happened afterwards?
answer: The devils entered into the swine and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the lake, and were choked. Luke8:33.

questions: How old was Jairus daughter when Jesus came to raise her back to life?
answer: She was about 12 years of age. Luke8:42.

questions: How long did the woman with the issue of blood have that issue for before she was healed?
Fill in the gap. “Weep not; she is not _________, but ___________.
When Jesus sent his disciples out to preach the kingdom of God, he told them to do something when they get to a place and they are not received, what was that?
answer: When ye go out of that city, shake off the very dust from your feet for a testimony against them. Luke8:5.

questions: When Jesus and his disciples were at a desert in a city called Bethsaida, and the multitude followed them, when it was time to feed them, what food was available?
answer: Five loaves and two fishes. Luke9:13.

questions: ______ made this statement; for I have a great sacrifice to do to Baal; whosoever shall be wanting, he shall not live.
King Ahaziah sent messengers to go enquire of ______.
answer: Baalzebub the god of Ekron. 2 Kings 1:2.

questions: Complete this verse, 2 Kings 6:5 “But as one was felling a beam, the axe head fell into the water: and he cried, and said, ________.
answer: Alas, master! For it was borrowed. 2 Kings 6:5.

questions: The disciples of Jesus, plucked what to eat on a Sabbath day?
answer: They plucked the ears of corn and did eat. Luke6:1.

questions: Whom did Jesus heal on a Sabbath that made the Scribes and Pharisees filled with madness and they communed about what they might do to Jesus.
answer: Jesus healed the man with the withered hand. Luke6:6.

questions: Fill in the gap, “And when it was day, he called unto him his disciples: and of them he chose __________, whom he also named __________.
Amongst Jesus disciples, there were two James, one was James the son of Zebedee, while the other was James the son of __________.
Who told Jesus that “I am not worthy that thou shouldest enter under my roof: Wherefore neither thought I myself worthy to come unto thee: but say in a word, and my servant shall be healed”.
Fill in the gap. “But wisdom is __________, of all her ____________.
________ brought the news of abundance to the porter of the city in 2kings7:9-10.
Who said these words? “The king of Israel hath hired against us the kings of the Hittites, and the kings of the Egyptians, to come upon us”.
_______ brought a generational curse upon his household according to 2kings 5:27.
What was Jesus response to the second temptation?
answer: Get thee behind me Satan, for it is written, Thou shalt worship the lord thy God and him only shalt thou serve. Luke4:8.

questions: What was Jesus response to the third temptation?
answer: It is said thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God. Luke4:12.

questions: After the temptation, Jesus came to Nazareth and went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day and stood up to read. What book was delivered to him?
answer: The book of the prophet Esaias. Luke4:17.

questions: Fill in the gap. Verily I say unto you, No _________ is accepted in his own ___________.
Fill in the gap, “Ans so was also James and John, the sons of _________, which were partners with Simon. And Jesus said unto Simon, Fear not; from henceforth, thou shalt catch _________.
When a man who had leprosy saw Jesus, he fell on his face and besought him saying, Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean. What was Jesus reaction?
answer: Jesus put forth his hand and touched him, saying, I will: be thou clean. Luke5:13.

questions: Who was Jehu's father?
Complete this verse, “Then he said, Go, borrow thee vessels abroad of all thy neighbours, even empty vessels; _______________”.
What was the first temptation the devil tempted Jesus with?
answer: If thou be the son of God, command this stone that it be made bread. Luke4:3.

questions: What was the second temptation?
answer: The devil showed him all the kingdom of the world and said he will give him the power over them and glory, if thou therefore wilt worship me, all shalt be thine. Luke4:5-6.

questions: What was the third temptation?
answer: Satan brought him to a pinnacle of the temple in Jerusalem and said unto him, if thou be the son of God, cast thyself down from hence. Luke4:9.

questions: What was Jesus response to the first temptation?
answer: It is written, that man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God. Luke4:4.

questions: When Jesus was teaching and some men brought in a man taken with a palsy through the tiling of the housetop and brought him before Jesus, what did he say?
answer: Man, thy sins are forgiven thee. Luke 5:20.

questions: Did Elisha put his hands on King Jeroboam’s hands when he asked him (Jeroboam) to put his hands on the bow?
How many times did King Jeroboam smite the arrows on the ground during his visit to Elisha?
What was the name of the publican, sitting at the receipt of custom that Jesus told to follow him?
When the mother of Jesus and his brethren came to him and couldn’t come at him for the press and Jesus was told, what was his response?
answer: My mother and my brethren are these which hear the word of God and do it. Luke8:21.

questions: When Jesus asked his disciples about whom people said he was, what was their response?
answer: They said, some said he was John the Baptist, some say Elias, and some say one of the old prophets is risen again. Luke9:18-19.
